A rioter dropped the hint that  the thing Bard took from the mountain in his animation was an egg... soooo, perhaps that will be Ao Shin?
Well, would be really intresting a dragon shooting lazors since newborn...
whats ao shin?
^ this guy
i dont actually know what you guys are talking about so..please remove your hand from your forehead and explain or send a link or something.

He was a champion teased by riot with a picture basically showing what his abilities would do (it was a black and white picture)

He got delayed because they couldn't fix a technical problem that prevented him from being made at the time. 

This was around a year ago..?

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2013/09/champion-sneak-peek-ao-shin.html

In 2 months it will be 2 years ago since his concept reveal.
In the meantime they have also said that he won't be ready this year.
they are just gonna cancel him all together watch

What?
I said they want Ao Shin.

Okay. *starts typing*

If I may ask why do people want Ao SHin? Is it because they think he's a bad ass looking champ or is just people want him to be a champ for the sake of him not becoming one for so long?

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Lord Fatgot,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wKcKB2tf,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2015-07-24T22:43:34.118+0000)

Semi decent looking champion that isn't part of the 'HOOMANOID' revolution that has been infecting league for the past year or so, also teased to have a very mechanically different style of play that could pave the way for much more complex champs and styles.
Soon ™-Riot
wish dumb mother fuckers like you would shut up about this go play smite if you want some stupid china dragon jesus even in that game is stupid
Okay friend. Why don't you go cool off before posting alright?
He had a bad day probably #reference

I really hope Ao Shin doesn't get released. I just don't like his concept.
inb4 8999 downvotes
Hey, we all deserve to voice our opinions. Makes me wonder why you bothered posting in this thread though.

> [{quoted}](name=A Superb Villain,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wKcKB2tf,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2015-07-24T16:19:18.805+0000)
>
> Hey, we all deserve to voice our opinions. Makes me wonder why you bothered posting in this thread though.

Because the point of forums is to express opinions? I don't like Ao Shin either, people are obsessed with him because he's not released yet. That's it.

I am acknowledging that in my first sentence to him. I am questioning why, if he does not want Ao Shin released, he would go into a thread that does want Ao Shin and post his opinion when he knows there is a majority that will attack him for it, which he anticipates in his own post, instead of just downvoting the thread and avoiding any backlash.

I mean, I like the new Fiora, some of her new models and walking animation being the exceptions, but I don't go into threads crying out for her to be changed and post my very unwelcome opinion.
It's called a martyr complex.  He feels that getting a ton of downvotes just makes him MORE right and makes it MORE important for him to "fight the good fight."
Not every thread has to be a circle jerk. He just posted his opinion on the topic of the thread.

Why not exactly? I would think being able to play as a full blooded dragon would be exciting, especially when a lot of people complain we have to many humans. 

I'm also a sucker for Ionian champs, but that's just me.

Ao Sh*t = Dragon
{{champion:102}} = Half-Dragon
Dragon = Neutral Monster at Jungle

Ao Shin = Eastern Dragon, like the ones pictured in China, Vietnam, Korea, Japan, etc.
Shyvana = Wyvern, a dragon-like creature (or full dragon, depending on source) from the Nordic countries and mountainous Chinese provinces.
Neutral Dragon in Jungle = European Dragon, like the ones pictured in most of the rest of Europe.

Greek/Turkish Dragons, Mesoamerican Dragons, Indian Dragons, and Pacific Northwest Dragons depictions are not seen in League.

Greek/Turkish, Indian, and Eastern Dragons lack wings entirely.
Wyverns and Pacific Northwest Dragons' wings also contain their hands, like a bat or pterosaur.
European and Mesoamerican Dragons are depicted as having wings as a separate set of limbs.
boy you need to learn what a wyvern is if you think shyvana is a wyvern
A wyvern is a dragon without fore arms, only wings (that act like fore arms and wings at the same time) and back legs. Shyvana's ult is a wyvern.
shyvana has forearms moron
A Wyvern has one set of wings that also function as their forelimb.  Wyverns commonly have a visible hand and fingers.  They're inspired by birds, bats, and pterosaurs.

*cough* These forearms sure do look like wings! Plus She flies during her ult.

EDIT: And if they were forearms, then wouldn't be a lizard then? And her title says she's a half-dragon. Wouldn't it be the half-lizard if they were forearms?
she doesn't fly genius she jumps
Shyvana's ult description says "Shyvana transforms  into a dragon and takes **flight** to a target location". FLIGHT, not jump.

> [{quoted}](name=Earthpine,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wKcKB2tf,comment-id=00110000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-25T10:02:25.565+0000)
>
> Shyvana's ult description says "Shyvana transforms  into a dragon and takes **flight** to a target location". FLIGHT, not jump.

It's more like a hop.
Fully fledged dragon flying would be drastically unbalanced.  I'm not talking about Ao Shin hovering either.
no kid it really wouldn't be hard to "balance" something that has literally no effect on the gameplay.

You think that.  Imagine if I could take Corki flying (untargeted) above the clouds and continue to use him as an ADC.  An flying, untargeted ADC.  That's the part I say is unbalanced.  He pilots a helicopter.  Are all helicopters limited to 6 inches off the ground?
Everytime I remember this champ it hurts my soul {{item:3070}}

Waiting for Ao shin be like.

I need this dragon in my life pls be mid lane +1 for you good sir
As long as he is not forgotten and we don't give our hopes up quite yet, we sha'll long for the day Ao Shin becomes released.
